item.title: #en @ 1459569309009776648
item.description: Lesson 3: I was only able to do this analysis because the data and materials were open. Open data are great. But (to use a @siminevazire analogy) transparency only opens the hood. You still need to see what the engine looks like.

item.title: #en @ 1458881854090711050
item.description: I think that better data on public transport costs in the UK would be amazing. Ideally much LESS data than we have now. Think about transport in London, the open data on fares is so simple. It's amazingly powerful. Elsewhere we get complexity and nuance which is far worse.

item.title: #en @ 1458796945078640646
item.description: There are some good things about the paper. Data are open on OSF, and upon re-analysis in different software (R) I achieve computational reproducibility for Table 2 and Figure 3 within rounding tolerance. This is already leagues better than many studies with no open data /2
